page.title: 06Education
page.content: The primary school in Medbourne closed in 1980 due to falling numbers. Children aged from five to eleven now travel by bus to Bringhurst Primary School - three miles away. The middle school for the area is Kibworth High School which caters for the eleven to fourteen age group; from here they transfer to the Robert Smyth School, Market Harborough where there is also a sixth form. Transport to these schools is provided free. Alternative state education is in Uppingham but transport is the responsibilty of the parents. A good percentage of children in the area attend private schools either as day pupils or as boarders. The Nevill Holt Preparatory School takes boys and girls from the age of four to thirteen. In Medbourne a playgroup, run by mothers and helpers, meets three mornings a week.
